plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning springtime display of delicate pink or white flowers, signaling the start of spring in many temperate regions.
plants.location: Japan, Korea, parts of China, and temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Cherry blossom festivals celebrate its fleeting bloom, which typically lasts only one to two weeks.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A bulbous perennial producing bright yellow trumpet-shaped flowers. It often colonizes woodland edges and meadows in early spring.
plants.location: Native to western Europe including the UK, Ireland, Spain, and Portugal
plants.funFact: The daffodil is associated with renewal and new beginnings and is a symbol used for cancer awareness campaigns.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree with cylindrical flower spikes composed of hundreds of tiny individual flowers, appearing in shades of yellow and orange.
plants.funFact: Banksias provide nectar and pollen resources crucial for native birds and mammals during late summer to early autumn.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia tree featuring large, tulip-shaped flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, often appearing before the leaves fully develop.
plants.location: Cultivated widely in temperate gardens worldwide, originally hybridized in France
plants.funFact: Magnolias are among the oldest flowering plants, with fossil records dating back over 95 million years.
